text:
Dresden is a city in Decatur County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, 41 people lived there.
History.
Dresden was created in 1888. It was named by German settlers after the city of Dresden, in Germany.
The first post office in Dresden was created in October 1888.
Dresden was a station on the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 41 people, 19 households, and 12 families living in the city.
